intro: Tricalysia nyassae, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and can grow as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its ornamental value makes it popular in horticulture, though it is also noted for its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Tricalysia nyassae is often cultivated for its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
